column1: … = data not available; | = marks break in series; – = magnitude equals zero; -0.0 or 0 = magnitude is less than half of unit employed; * = provisional, preliminary, estimate, budget figure; $ = United States dollars; cif = cost, insurance, and freight; fob = free on board; GDP = gross domestic product; GNI = gross national income; km2 = square kilometer; kWh = kilowatt-hour; NPISHs = nonprofit institutions serving households; Q = quarter.

column2: Data are intercensal estimates based on the 1999 and 2011 population censuses. For 2000–2010, data are population projections based on annual population growth rates derived from data on births, deaths, and migration. For 2012–2018, data are based on the 2011 census and the average annual growth rate for 1999–2011.
Values were adjusted to make the total GDP by production approach consistent with the GDP estimates using the expenditure approach. Differences in values are captured in "Statistical discrepancy".
Estimated as the difference between GDP by industrial origin at current market prices and final consumption expenditure.

Consumption is based on gross demand for electricity; values for 2011 and 2015–2016 are estimates. Production is based on gross production of electricity; values for 2007–2011 and 2014–2016 are estimates.
Refers to housing, utilities, and appliances
Refers to other goods and services.

For 2000, data are computed as the average of four quarters on a calendar year basis. For 2001–2012, data are computed as the average of five quarters on a fiscal year basis. For 2013 onward, data are presented by fiscal year ending 30 September.
Refers to the sum of demand deposits, savings deposit, time deposits, and time and savings deposits.
Refers to claims on central and local governments.
Refers to claims on public enterprises, including the Marshall Islands Development Bank and state-owned enterprises.
Refers to government deposits, including deposits of social security administration and other trust funds.
Follows the IMF's Government Finance Statistics Manual 2014.
Direction of trade statistics are estimated based on counterpart data.
Follows the IMF's Balance of Payments and International Investment Position Manual (sixth edition).
Item refers to free on board.
The unit of currency of the Marshall Islands is the United States dollar.
Refers to government and government-guaranteed debt only.
